description:
encoding/xml: fix the example for Unmarshal

Since rev 70e914beb409, all matching is case sensitive.
So tag must be added to the field for unmarshal in the example.

messages.text:
It's unfortunate to make the example look like these
xml tags are required.  Can we please change the
XML instead, to use names that match (<Where> etc)?

Thanks.
Russ

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
http://code.google.com/p/go/

Because the example of marshal and some tests uses tag for each field, so the same I used for unmarshal for consistent. And because go uses uppercase for exported field, it's normally required to use tag for field, especially for the xml is not generated by encoding/xml. I think that changing the XML only doesn't reflect the case sensitive well either, although tag for each tag can be confusing. Maybe it needs more explanation.

R+=gustavo

On Tue, Feb 14, 2012 at 19:52,  <hongruiqi@gmail.com> wrote:
> Because the example of marshal and some tests uses tag for each field,
> so the same I used for unmarshal for consistent. And because go uses
> uppercase for exported field, it's normally required to use tag for
> field, especially for the xml is not generated by encoding/xml. I think
> that changing the XML only doesn't reflect the case sensitive well
> either, although tag for each tag can be confusing. Maybe it needs more
> explanation.
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5667043/

Hi Hong,

Thanks for the change, and sorry about the broken example.

On Tue, Feb 14, 2012 at 22:52,  <hongruiqi@gmail.com> wrote:
> Because the example of marshal and some tests uses tag for each field,
> so the same I used for unmarshal for consistent. And because go uses
> uppercase for exported field, it's normally required to use tag for
> field, especially for the xml is not generated by encoding/xml. I think
> that changing the XML only doesn't reflect the case sensitive well
> either, although tag for each tag can be confusing. Maybe it needs more
> explanation.

I agree with Russ. The example is supposed to show a few variations so
that the developer can look at the input, compare with the output, and
infer what is going on.

Would you mind to leave that with me?  I'll take this example out of
the documentation string and into the executable examples file that is
being introduced for Marshal, so that it looks nicer on godoc and it's
harder for people like me to screw up when updating the code.

-- 
Gustavo Niemeyer
http://niemeyer.net
http://niemeyer.net/plus
http://niemeyer.net/twitter
http://niemeyer.net/blog

-- I'm not absolutely sure of anything.

Hong, here is the suggested change:

http://codereview.appspot.com/5671062/
